cs.man.ac.uk.data

Class DataFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.obj.BaseObject
      • cs.man.ac.uk.data.DataFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ARFFFile, CSVFile

    public abstract class DataFile
extends BaseObject
    Simple file object, base of file object hierarchy for this project.
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.io.BufferedReader br
      Used to read in the file.
      protected int[] classDist
      The class distribution of the data in the file.
      protected java.lang.String commentSymbol
      The symbol used to signify a comment in the data file.
      protected int examples
      Number of examples in the data file.
      protected int features
      Number of features (data attributes) in the file.
      protected boolean isValid
      Flag that indicates the validity of the file, invalid files cannot be processed.
      protected java.lang.String path
      Path to the data file (absolute path).
      protected boolean readIncrementally
      Flag that indicates if the file should be read incrementally or not.
      protected java.lang.String separator
      The symbol used to separate data items in the file.

        Path to the data file (absolute path).

        Number of examples in the data file.

        Number of features (data attributes) in the file.

      • classDist

        protected int[] classDist
        The class distribution of the data in the file.

      • isValid

        protected boolean isValid
        Flag that indicates the validity of the file, invalid files cannot be processed.

      • commentSymbol

        protected java.lang.String commentSymbol
        The symbol used to signify a comment in the data file.

      • separator

        protected java.lang.String separator
        The symbol used to separate data items in the file.

      • readIncrementally

        protected boolean readIncrementally
        Flag that indicates if the file should be read incrementally or not. If not read incrementally, then the file must be read in to memory in a single pass.

      • br

        protected java.io.BufferedReader br
        Used to read in the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataFile

        public DataFile(java.lang.String pth,
                boolean inc,
                boolean v)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        pth - the full path to the file on disk.
        inc - a boolean flag that indicates whether or not to read the
        v - the verbose logging flag file incrementally. True means read incrementally.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public java.util.List<I_Instance> read()
        Processes the data file, and extracts all possible data instances.
        Returns:
        a list of data instances, else null if there are any errors.

      • readNext

        public I_Instance readNext()
        Reads the next individual instance from the data file.
        Returns:
        the next I_Instance example from the file, else null if there is an error.

      • closeFile

        public void closeFile()
        Explicitly closes the data file, if it is being read incrementally.

      • getCommentSymbol

        public java.lang.String getCommentSymbol()
        Returns:
        the symbol which signifies the start of a comment in the data file.

      • setCommentSymbol

        public void setCommentSymbol(java.lang.String sym)
        Sets the comment symbols used by this data file.
        Parameters:
        sym - the symbol which signifies the start of a comment in the data file.

        Returns:
        the symbol used to separate data items in the file.

      • createInstance

        public abstract I_Instance createInstance(java.lang.String line)
        Creates a new data instance.
        Parameters:
        line - a string describing a line from a data file.
        Returns:
        a new instance object created from the line, esle null if there are any errors.

      • createInstance

        public abstract I_Instance createInstance(double[] data)
        Creates a new data instance.
        Parameters:
        data - the numerical data.
        Returns:
        a new instance object created from the line, else null if there are any errors.

      • checkValidity

        public abstract boolean checkValidity()
        Checks the validity of the file.
        Returns:
        true if valid, else false.

      • doesLineContainValidData

        public abstract double[] doesLineContainValidData(java.lang.String line)
        Checks if a line of data from the file represented by this class, is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        line - the line of data from the data file.
        Returns:
        the numerical data if valid (including the class label), else null.

      • removeComment

        public abstract java.lang.String removeComment(java.lang.String symbol,
                                               java.lang.String line)
        Removes comments appended to the end of a line of data, where a comment starts at the supplied comment symbol.
        Parameters:
        symbol - that signals the start of a comment.
        line - the text to remove the comment from.
        Returns:
        the processed string, or null if the string is empty.

      • prepareFile

        public abstract void prepareFile()
        Prepares the data file if needed to be read incrementally.
